== Main Inclusion Report for opensync ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/o/opensync]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of kdepim
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=opensync|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none

** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid. No daemons
** Network activity: does not open any port.  Does not handle incoming network data
** No source code review performed
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** In no situations does the package not work out of the box without configuration
** The package asks no debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:opensync|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: only wishlist oipen
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/o/opensync.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is prompt in line with upstream releases (also maintained by Robert Collins)
** <nowiki>[[http://www.opensync.org/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://www.opensync.org/report/1|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Hardware: This package deals with a range of hardware
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliant
** Packaging system debhelper, no patches or packaging oddities
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** glib, swig, libsqllite, libxml2, check
** all in main
 0. ''Background information:''

** Upstream call this software opensync
